Class KeyStorage

java.lang.Object
  KeyStorage

public class KeyStorage
extends java.lang.Object

Manages the keys being pressed and released on the keyboard

Author:
John Kim, Tanner Lai, Raymond Zhao

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a KeyStorage
 
Method Summary
 void add(int key)
          This method adds a user key input into the array at the first valid location and changes the array accordingly.
 void clear(int index)
          This method clears the key at the given index
 void clearAllKeys()
          Clears all the keys within the array.
 void clearEmpty()
          This method moves all zeroes to the end of the array.
 int[] getAllKeys()
          Returns all the characters, stored in an array
 int getKeyAt(int index)
          This method returns the character code at the given index or otherwise return a 0.
 void remove(int key)
          This method removes a key if it is within the array.

Method Detail

add

public void add(int key)
This method adds a user key input into the array at the first valid location and changes the array accordingly.

Parameters:
key - The character code of the key added by the user.

remove

public void remove(int key)
This method removes a key if it is within the array.

Parameters:
key - The character code of the key removed by the user.

clearEmpty

public void clearEmpty()
This method moves all zeroes to the end of the array.

clear

public void clear(int index)
This method clears the key at the given index

Parameters:
index - The location within the key's array of the requested clearing.

clearAllKeys

public void clearAllKeys()
Clears all the keys within the array.

getKeyAt

public int getKeyAt(int index)
This method returns the character code at the given index or otherwise return a 0.

Parameters:
index - The location within the key's array of the requested character.

getAllKeys

public int[] getAllKeys()
Returns all the characters, stored in an array
